ATC_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

ATC_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate
ATC_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain

ATC_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate
ATC_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain

ATC_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate
ATC_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain

ATC_HOVR_ROL_TRM.Description: Trim the hover roll angle to counter tail rotor thrust in a hover

ATC_INPUT_TC.Description: Attitude control input time constant.  Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

ATC_RATE_P_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

ATC_RATE_R_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

ATC_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

ATC_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_D_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D feedforward gain.
ATC_RAT_PIT_D_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D feedforward gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
ATC_RAT_PIT_ILMI.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
ATC_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_PIT_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_D_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller D feedforward gain.
ATC_RAT_RLL_D_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D feedforward gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
ATC_RAT_RLL_ILMI.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
ATC_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_RLL_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_YAW_D_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D feedforward gain.
ATC_RAT_YAW_D_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D feedforward gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
ATC_RAT_YAW_ILMI.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum

ATC_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
ATC_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain

ATC_RAT_YAW_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

ATC_THR_G_BOOST.Description: Throttle-gain boost ratio. A value of 0 means no boosting is applied, a value of 1 means full boosting is applied. Describes the ratio increase that is applied to angle P and PD on pitch and roll.

ATC_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

PILOT_Y_RATE_TC.Description: Pilot yaw rate control input time constant
PILOT_Y_RATE_TC.DisplayName: Pilot yaw rate control input time constant

INS_ACC1_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 1st accelerometer was calibrated at

INS_ACC2OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of X axis.  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Y axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Z axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 2nd accelerometer was calibrated at

INS_ACC2_ID.Description: Accelerometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC3OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of X axis.  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Y axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Z axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 3rd accelerometer was calibrated at

INS_ACC3_ID.Description: Accelerometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACCEL_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis.  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis  Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC_BODYFIX.Description: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

INS_ACC_ID.Description: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ENABLE_MASK.Description: Bitmask of IMUs to enable. It can be used to prevent startup of specific detected IMUs

INS_FAST_SAMPLE.Description: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

INS_GYR1_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 1st gyroscope was calibrated at

INS_GYR2OFFS_X.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 2nd gyroscope was calibrated at

INS_GYR2_ID.Description: Gyro2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR3OFFS_X.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3_CALTEMP.Description: Temperature that the 3rd gyroscope was calibrated at

INS_GYR3_ID.Description: Gyro3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYRO_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_GYRO_RATE.Description: Gyro rate for IMUs with fast sampling enabled. The gyro rate is the sample rate at which the IMU filters operate and needs to be at least double the maximum filter frequency. If the sensor does not support the selected rate the next highest supported rate will be used. For IMUs which do not support fast sampling this setting is ignored and the default gyro rate of 1Khz is used.
INS_GYRO_RATE.DisplayName: Gyro rate for IMUs with Fast Sampling enabled

INS_GYR_CAL.Description: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

INS_GYR_ID.Description: Gyro sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_POS1_X.Description: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Y.Description: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Z.Description: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_X.Description: X position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_Y.Description: Y position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_Z.Description: Z position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_X.Description: X position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_Y.Description: Y position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_Z.Description: Z position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_STILL_THRESH.Description: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5
INS_STILL_THRESH.DisplayName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving

INS_TCAL_OPTIONS.Description: This enables optional temperature calibration features. Setting PersistParams will save the accelerometer and temperature calibration parameters in the bootloader sector on the next update of the bootloader.

INS_TRIM_OPTION.Description: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

Values.2: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

INS_USE.Description: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE.DisplayName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE2.Description: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE2.DisplayName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE3.Description: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE3.DisplayName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_HNTC2_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

INS_HNTC2_BW.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

INS_HNTC2_FM_RAT.Description: The minimum ratio below the configured frequency to take throttle based notch filters when flying at a throttle level below the reference throttle. Note that lower frequency notch filters will have more phase lag. If you want throttle based notch filtering to be effective at a throttle up to 30% below the configured notch frequency then set this parameter to 0.7. The default of 1.0 means the notch will not go below the frequency in the FREQ parameter.

INS_HNTC2_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

INS_HNTC2_HMNCS.Description: Bitmask of harmonic frequencies to apply Harmonic Notch Filter to. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of 0 disables this filter. The first harmonic refers to the base frequency.

INS_HNTC2_MODE.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode. Dynamic updates can be throttle, RPM sensor, ESC telemetry or dynamic FFT based. Throttle-based updates should only be used with multicopters.
INS_HNTC2_MODE.DisplayName: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode

INS_HNTC2_OPTS.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter options. Triple and double-notches can provide deeper attenuation across a wider bandwidth with reduced latency than single notches and are suitable for larger aircraft. Multi-Source attaches a harmonic notch to each detected noise frequency instead of simply being multiples of the base frequency, in the case of FFT it will attach notches to each of three detected noise peaks, in the case of ESC it will attach notches to each of four motor RPM values. Loop rate update changes the notch center frequency at the scheduler loop rate rather than at the default of 200Hz. If both double and triple notches are specified only double notches will take effect.

INS_HNTC2_REF.Description: A reference value of zero disables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter and a positive value enables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter.  For throttle-based scaling, this parameter is the reference value associated with the specified frequency to facilitate frequency scaling of the Harmonic Notch Filter. For RPM and ESC telemetry based tracking, this parameter is set to 1 to enable the Harmonic Notch Filter using the RPM sensor or ESC telemetry set to measure rotor speed.  The sensor data is converted to Hz automatically for use in the Harmonic Notch Filter.  This reference value may also be used to scale the sensor data, if required.  For example, rpm sensor data is required to measure heli motor RPM. Therefore the reference value can be used to scale the RPM sensor to the rotor RPM.

INS_HNTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

INS_HNTCH_BW.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

INS_HNTCH_FM_RAT.Description: The minimum ratio below the configured frequency to take throttle based notch filters when flying at a throttle level below the reference throttle. Note that lower frequency notch filters will have more phase lag. If you want throttle based notch filtering to be effective at a throttle up to 30% below the configured notch frequency then set this parameter to 0.7. The default of 1.0 means the notch will not go below the frequency in the FREQ parameter.

INS_HNTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

INS_HNTCH_HMNCS.Description: Bitmask of harmonic frequencies to apply Harmonic Notch Filter to. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of 0 disables this filter. The first harmonic refers to the base frequency.

INS_HNTCH_MODE.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode. Dynamic updates can be throttle, RPM sensor, ESC telemetry or dynamic FFT based. Throttle-based updates should only be used with multicopters.
INS_HNTCH_MODE.DisplayName: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode

INS_HNTCH_OPTS.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter options. Triple and double-notches can provide deeper attenuation across a wider bandwidth with reduced latency than single notches and are suitable for larger aircraft. Multi-Source attaches a harmonic notch to each detected noise frequency instead of simply being multiples of the base frequency, in the case of FFT it will attach notches to each of three detected noise peaks, in the case of ESC it will attach notches to each of four motor RPM values. Loop rate update changes the notch center frequency at the scheduler loop rate rather than at the default of 200Hz. If both double and triple notches are specified only double notches will take effect.

INS_HNTCH_REF.Description: A reference value of zero disables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter and a positive value enables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter.  For throttle-based scaling, this parameter is the reference value associated with the specified frequency to facilitate frequency scaling of the Harmonic Notch Filter. For RPM and ESC telemetry based tracking, this parameter is set to 1 to enable the Harmonic Notch Filter using the RPM sensor or ESC telemetry set to measure rotor speed.  The sensor data is converted to Hz automatically for use in the Harmonic Notch Filter.  This reference value may also be used to scale the sensor data, if required.  For example, rpm sensor data is required to measure heli motor RPM. Therefore the reference value can be used to scale the RPM sensor to the rotor RPM.

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

FILT1_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT1_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT1_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

FILT2_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT2_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT2_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

FILT3_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT3_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT3_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

FILT4_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT4_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT4_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

FILT5_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT5_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT5_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

FILT6_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT6_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT6_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

FILT7_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT7_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT7_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

FILT8_NOTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

FILT8_NOTCH_Q.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

FILT8_NOTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This is the center frequency for static notches, the center frequency for Throttle based notches at the reference thrust value, and the minimum limit of center frequency variation for all other notch types. This should always be set lower than half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz).

Q_A_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

Q_A_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
Q_A_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

Q_A_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate
Q_A_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain

Q_A_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate
Q_A_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain

Q_A_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate
Q_A_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain

Q_A_HOVR_ROL_TRM.Description: Trim the hover roll angle to counter tail rotor thrust in a hover

Q_A_INPUT_TC.Description: Attitude control input time constant.  Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

Q_A_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

Q_A_RATE_P_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

Q_A_RATE_R_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

Q_A_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

Q_A_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
Q_A_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain

Q_A_RAT_PIT_D_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D feedforward gain.
Q_A_RAT_PIT_D_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D feedforward gain

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
Q_A_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

Q_A_RAT_PIT_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
Q_A_RAT_PIT_ILMI.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum

Q_A_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
Q_A_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain

Q_A_RAT_PIT_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Q_A_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
Q_A_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain

Q_A_RAT_RLL_D_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller D feedforward gain.
Q_A_RAT_RLL_D_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D feedforward gain

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
Q_A_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain

Q_A_RAT_RLL_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
Q_A_RAT_RLL_ILMI.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum

Q_A_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
Q_A_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain

Q_A_RAT_RLL_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Q_A_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
Q_A_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_YAW_D_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D feedforward gain.
Q_A_RAT_YAW_D_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D feedforward gain

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
Q_A_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain

Q_A_RAT_YAW_ILMI.Description: Point below which I-term will not leak down
Q_A_RAT_YAW_ILMI.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I-term leak minimum

Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum

Q_A_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
Q_A_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain

Q_A_RAT_YAW_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Q_A_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

Q_A_THR_G_BOOST.Description: Throttle-gain boost ratio. A value of 0 means no boosting is applied, a value of 1 means full boosting is applied. Describes the ratio increase that is applied to angle P and PD on pitch and roll.

Q_A_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_A_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_A_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)
